data.title: US equity fund inflows eased before Fed decision and big tech earnings
data.description:
U.S. equity fund inflows cooled significantly in the week to October 29 as investors refrained from taking major bets in the lead-up to an anticipated Federal Reserve rate cut and a batch of earnings reports from big technology companies.

Investors bought $1.81 billion worth of U.S. equity funds during the week, a sharp reduction from approximately $9.65 billion weekly net purchase the prior week, LSEG Lipper data showed.

The Fed trimmed interest rates by 0.25% as expected on Wednesday but signaled it could keep rates steady in December in absence of data from the federal government.

Meanwhile, Alphabet , Amazon and Apple delivered upbeat earnings commentary this week, while Meta Platforms and Microsoft's spending plans disappointed investors.

The U.S. large-cap equity funds segment attracted a second successive weekly inflow, to the tune of $1.57 billion. Mid-cap and small-cap funds, however, saw $1.65 billion and $1.44 billion weekly outflows, respectively.

The technology sector, meanwhile, had a net $1.65 billion weekly inflow, the largest since October 1. In contrast, financials and consumer discretionary saw outflows of $662 million and $314 million, respectively.

Investors bought $4.91 billion of U.S. bond funds as they extended the trend of inflows into a fourth straight week.

They scooped up U.S. short-to-intermediate investment-grade funds and general domestic taxable fixed income funds of $1.72 billion and $1.47 billion, respectively, while divesting a net $1.23 billion worth of short-to-intermediate government and Treasury funds.

Money market funds saw inflows for a second successive week, valued at a net $1.46 billion.

data.title: W.W. Grainger Posts Higher 3Q Sales, But Lowers FY Sales Outlook
data.description:
By Nicholas G. Miller

W.W. Grainger reported higher third-quarter sales on the back of growth in its business supplying small and medium-sized businesses, but lowered its full-year revenue outlook.

The industrial supplies distributor reported net income of $294 million, or $6.12 a share, down from $486 million, or $9.87 a share, the year prior.

The company's quarterly profit was dragged down by a non-cash loss related to its exit of the U.K. market. W.W. Grainger said earlier this month it would sell its U.K.-based business to private-equity firm Aurelius.

Third-quarter adjusted earnings were $10.21 a share. Analysts expected $9.95 a share, according to FactSet.

Delivered sales rose 6.1% to $4.66 billion. Wall Street expected $4.64 billion. The company's endless assortment segment, which targets small and medium-sized businesses with less complex needs, saw sales grow 18% year-over-year.

The company lowered its full-year sales guidance to $17.8 billion to $18 billion, down from its previous forecast of $17.9 billion to $18.2 billion.

It narrowed its full-year adjusted earnings outlook to $39 to $39.75 a share, compared with its previous guidance of $38.50 to $40.25 a share.

Analysts expect sales of $18.03 billion and adjusted earnings of $39.47 a share.

Write to Nicholas G. Miller at nicholas.miller@wsj.com.

data.title: SONIM TECHNOLOGIES INC SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Sonim Technologies Inc., a leading provider of enterprise 5G solutions, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report highlights the company's financial performance and key business developments, reflecting its ongoing efforts to expand its product portfolio and market reach.

Financial Highlights

Total Net Revenues: $16.2 million, an increase of $1.2 million or 8% compared to the same period in 2024, driven by sales of new hotspot products.

Gross Profit: $1.8 million, a decrease of $2.4 million or 57% compared to 2024, reflecting lower margins on new products.

Income (loss) from operations: $(4.0) million, an increased loss by $1.6 million or 68% compared to 2024, due to increased operating expenses.

Net income (loss): $(4.8) million, an increased loss by $2.2 million or 89% compared to 2024, impacted by higher interest and other expenses.

Business Highlights

Company Overview: Sonim Technologies is a leading provider of enterprise 5G solutions, offering rugged handsets, smartphones, wireless internet devices, software, services, and accessories. The company serves sectors such as critical communications, first responders, government, industrial, construction, hospitality, and logistics.

Geographical Performance: Sonim has expanded its market reach with products available at all three U.S. Tier-one carriers and the three primary carriers in Canada, as well as Telstra in Australia. The company also sells through distributors and resellers in Europe and South Africa.

New Product Launches: In 2024 and 2025, Sonim launched several new products, including the Sonim H500-series of 5G mobile hotspots, Sonim MegaConnect 5G HPUE rugged mobile hotspot, Sonim H100 4G mobile hotspot, XP100 4G and XP400 5G professional rugged phones, XP Pro 5G rugged smartphone, XP Pro Thermal 5G rugged smartphone, and XP3plus 5G rugged flip phone.

Product Certification: In 2025, all new products launched with tier-one carriers in the U.S. included certifications such as FirstNet Ready, FirstNet Trusted, Verizon Frontline Certified, and T-Mobile certified for T-Priority.

Revenue Segments: For the nine months ended September 30, 2025, rugged smartphones represented 54% of total net revenues, feature phones were 28%, and connected solutions were 16%.

Customer Base: The company's customer base is highly concentrated, with wireless carriers contributing 83% of total net revenues for the nine months ended September 30, 2025.

Future Outlook: Sonim is focused on expanding its product portfolio throughout 2025 and is pursuing strategic alternatives to maximize stockholder value, including a pending asset purchase agreement with Social Mobile.

Trade Agreements Act Compliance: Sonim has prioritized TAA compliance to enhance market strategy and expand opportunities within government and enterprise markets.

Reverse Stock Split: On October 27, 2025, Sonim effected a 1-for-18 reverse stock split of its common stock to better align with its long-term strategy.

Capital Structure: The company increased its authorized shares of common stock from 100 million to 1 billion to provide greater flexibility for corporate purposes.

SEC Filing: SONIM TECHNOLOGIES INC [ SONM ] - 10-Q - Oct. 31, 2025

data.title: Cboe Global Markets, Inc. SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Cboe Global Markets, Inc., a leading provider of market infrastructure and tradable products, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter. The report highlights significant financial growth and operational advancements, underscoring the company's robust performance in the derivatives market and its strategic expansion in global markets.

Financial Highlights

  • Total Revenues: $1,141.7 million, reflecting an increase from $1,055.7 million in the same period last year, driven by growth in derivatives markets.
  • Revenues less cost of revenues: $605.5 million, indicating improved efficiency with a higher margin compared to the previous year.
  • Operating Income: $370.3 million, up from $307.4 million, showcasing effective cost management and operational efficiency.
  • Net Income: $300.8 million, an increase from $218.5 million, highlighting strong financial performance.
  • Net Income allocated to common stockholders: $299.3 million, compared to $217.4 million in the prior year, reflecting increased profitability.
  • Basic earnings per share: $2.86, up from $2.08, indicating higher returns for shareholders.
  • Diluted earnings per share: $2.85, compared to $2.07, demonstrating improved earnings performance.

Business Highlights

  • Revenue Segments: The company operates across three main revenue segments: Cash and Spot Markets, Data Vantage, and Derivatives Markets. Each segment contributes to the company's diversified product offerings and expansive geographical reach.
  • Geographical Performance: The company has a significant presence in North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific. The Europe and Asia Pacific segment includes Cboe Europe, one of the largest equities exchanges by value traded in Europe, and Cboe Clear Europe, a leading pan-European equities and derivatives clearinghouse.
  • Sales Units: The company reported increased transaction and clearing fees across its segments, with notable growth in the Derivatives Markets segment, reflecting higher trading volumes.
  • New Product Launches: The company introduced a service for European Securities Financing Transactions (SFT) in cash equities and ETFs through Cboe Clear Europe, enhancing the bilateral SFT process into a centrally cleared model.
  • New Production Launches: Cboe Clear Europe received regulatory approval to offer access to market participants for SFT clearing, marking a significant expansion in its service offerings.
  • Future Outlook: The company plans to continue leveraging its core strengths in derivatives, technology, and product innovation, with a focus on expanding its clearing services and enhancing its market data offerings.

SEC Filing: Cboe Global Markets, Inc. [ CBOE ] - 10-Q - Oct. 31, 2025

data.title: AtkinsRealis Joins Long-Term Nuclear Decommissioning Contract in U.K.
data.description:
By Adriano Marchese

AtkinsRealis Group said it has been selected to participate in a long-term contract to decommission a nuclear facility in the U.K.

The Canadian engineering and infrastructure services firm, which focuses on nuclear, transportation, and project management, said Friday that it has been appointed by Sellafield to a new framework delivering decommissioning activities for up to 15 years.

AtkinsRealis will work on three of the four lots that are part of the decommissioning contract in two separate joint ventures to deliver a broad scope of services, from remediation and retrievals to technical services and construction delivery and demolition, it said.

Montreal-based AtkinsRealis said the Sellafield contract has a total maximum value of 4.6 billion pounds, roughly the equivalent of $6.05 billion, set to be in place for an initial nine years with an option for a further six years, to 2040.

Write to Adriano Marchese at adriano.marchese@wsj.com

data.title: Yomiuri: Japan to Launch Council to Review Policies on Foreign Nationals
data.description:
The Yomiuri Shimbun

The Japanese government plans to launch a new ministerial council to review policies on foreigners, a move that may lead to stricter rules on foreign nationals, according to government sources.

Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi is expected to instruct relevant ministers to implement measures on issues related to foreigners. These are expected to include stricter responses to crimes, ensuring proper operation of currently misused systems and identifying the current status of land ownership.

Basic policies will be finalized around January after the launch of an expert panel comprising specialists on topics such as population issues, economics, multicultural coexistence, social security and land policy.

According to the sources, the name of the council of relevant ministries will reflect its mission of achieving the acceptance of foreign nationals and a society of well-ordered and harmonious coexistence.

The new council will serve as a new command center for the initiative and be formed from an existing body that previously coordinated overall policies on matters such as the acceptance of foreign personnel.

Chief Cabinet Secretary Minoru Kihara will chair the council, while economic security minister Kimi Onoda, who is also in charge of policies relating to foreign nationals, and Justice Minister Hiroshi Hiraguchi will serve as vice chairs.

The council is likely to focus on tightening regulations to ease public concern and a sense of unfairness amid a rise in the number of foreign workers and tourists.

In her first policy speech on Oct. 24, Takaichi said she would take a firm stance on foreigners acting illegally and deviating from rules, while emphasizing that she would "draw a clear line against xenophobia."

The first meeting is expected to be held next week. Takaichi will request consideration of such matters as improving residency management, tightening the requirements for naturalization and addressing overtourism, as well as security measures and land acquisitions by foreigners.

----

This article is from The Yomiuri Shimbun. Neither Dow Jones Newswires, MarketWatch, Barron's nor The Wall Street Journal were involved in the creation of this content.

YDN-M0000154560-1

data.title: Mammoth Energy Services, Inc. Announces Third Quarter 2025 Results
data.description:
Mammoth Energy Services, Inc. reported its financial and operational results for the third quarter ended September 30, 2025. The company, which provides products and services primarily to the oil and natural gas and infrastructure industries, highlighted several key financial metrics and strategic initiatives in its latest SEC 8-K filing.

Financial Highlights

For the third quarter of 2025, Mammoth Energy Services reported total revenue from continuing operations of $14.8 million, a decrease from $17.1 million in the same period of 2024 and $16.4 million in the second quarter of 2025. The net loss from continuing operations was $12.1 million, or $0.25 per diluted share, compared to a net loss of $8.9 million, or $0.18 per diluted share, in the third quarter of 2024 and $35.7 million, or $0.74 per diluted share, in the second quarter of 2025. Adjusted EBITDA from continuing operations was ($4.4) million, compared to ($2.9) million in the third quarter of 2024 and ($2.8) million in the second quarter of 2025.

Business and Operational Highlights

The infrastructure services segment contributed $4.8 million in revenue, up from $4.4 million in the third quarter of 2024 but down from $5.4 million in the second quarter of 2025. The rental services segment saw revenue of $2.8 million, an increase from $2.2 million in the third quarter of 2024 but a decrease from $3.1 million in the second quarter of 2025. The natural sand proppant services segment reported revenue of $2.7 million, down from $4.9 million in the third quarter of 2024 and $5.4 million in the second quarter of 2025. The accommodation services segment contributed $2.3 million in revenue, compared to $2.9 million in the third quarter of 2024 and $1.8 million in the second quarter of 2025. The drilling services segment saw revenue of $2.3 million, up from $1.6 million in the third quarter of 2024 and $0.7 million in the second quarter of 2025.

Strategic Initiatives and Corporate Developments

During the quarter, Mammoth completed the divestiture of its Piranha assets within the Sand segment, a strategic move to exit lower-return assets. The company continued to deploy capital in its aviation platform, which remains a high-return and scalable growth area. As of September 30, 2025, Mammoth had approximately $153.4 million in total liquidity and no debt, providing exceptional financial flexibility.

Management's Perspective

Mark Layton, Chief Financial Officer of Mammoth, commented, "Mammoth continued to make meaningful progress this quarter in advancing our transformation and strengthening the foundation of the Company. These actions reflect our disciplined approach to building a leaner, more efficient organization centered on consistent cash generation and long-term value creation."

Future Outlook

With a strong balance sheet and continued focus on operational execution, Mammoth believes it is well-positioned to build durable value and deliver sustainable performance through cycles. The company closed the quarter with approximately $153.4 million in total liquidity and no debt, providing exceptional financial flexibility to navigate market conditions and pursue opportunities that align with its return thresholds.

Original SEC Filing: MAMMOTH ENERGY SERVICES, INC. [ TUSK ] - 8-K - Oct. 31, 2025

Disclaimer
This is an AI-powered summary. It may contain inaccuracies. Consider verifying important information with the source. Please note this summary is solely based on documents filed with the SEC.

data.title: Indian central bank's forward book expands after six months as it mounts rupee defense
data.description:
India's central bank increased its short dollar forward positions by $6 billion in September, marking the first rise in six months, data released on Friday showed, as it intensified efforts to curb pressure on the rupee.

The Reserve Bank of India's net short position in FX forwards and futures stood at $59.4 billion as of September-end signaling continued sales of dollars in the forward market. The data is released with a one-month lag.

The FX forward book reflects positions in both non-deliverable forwards (NDF) and the onshore forward markets, which had peaked in February. Analysts had anticipated the September rise.

"The increase of the forward book reflects RBI intervention to defend the INR and reduce the drain on banking system liquidity," said Gaura Sen Gupta, chief economist at IDFC First Bank.

The rupee weakened for a fifth consecutive month in September, hitting a record low of 88.80 against the dollar.

The decline was attributed to dollar outflows linked to gold imports by jewelry firms, foreign portfolio withdrawals, and concerns over steep U.S. tariffs on Indian goods.

Despite the RBI's interventions, the rupee continued to face pressure through October as importer and NDF-related dollar demand and the Federal Reserve's hawkish stance weighed.

While the central bank actively defended the 88.80 level early in the month, efforts to push it towards 87.60 proved short-lived. By Friday, the rupee had declined to 88.7650, within touching distance of its record low.

Economists expect the RBI's short forward book to expand further in October, reflecting its intensified interventions.

"The forward book would have expanded further with the RBI's defence of the INR becoming more pronounced (in October)," Sen Gupta said.

data.title: India regulator likely to penalise MCX for four-hour trading halt, sources say
data.description:
India’s markets regulator is likely to penalise Multi Commodity Exchange for a four-hour outage on Tuesday that was caused by a trading spike, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Friday.

The disruption was a result of a "capacity breach”, with the exchange unable to handle the number of clients trading on that day, according to the sources.

They did not want to be named as they are not authorised to speak to media. The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) did not respond to an emailed query.

MCX on Friday said its systems had predefined parameters that limit the number of so-called 'unique client codes’, "which led to constraints beyond the threshold.” Its trading systems remain stable, the exchange added.

SEBI is concerned about the delay in identifying the cause for the trading halt and could direct MCX to improve its system capacity, the sources said.

"Had MCX early on Tuesday identified that it was facing a capacity breach, trading could have resumed much faster,” the first source said.

SEBI requires shifting trading to a disaster recovery site when trading halts on the main exchange. However, this option did not help the exchange, the source said.

"Since the root cause was capacity breach, it continued to persist in disaster recovery site as well due to the volume spike,” the source said.

MCX said it has taken steps to prevent similar issues in the future.

TRADERS TO APPROACH SEBI

The trading halt led to many bullion traders reporting losses, prompting them to approach the India Bullion and Jewellers Association Ltd (IBJA), a lobby body, to take up their case with the regulator.

Trading delays and halts on MCX have become increasingly frequent this year, causing losses for traders, an IBJA official, who declined to be named, said.

A Mumbai-based bullion dealer said that he was forced to book larger losses due to the delay in resuming operations.

"Gold and silver prices were correcting in the global market. Everyone, including us, who held long positions wanted to exit quickly, but we couldn’t,” he said.

data.title: 300,000,003 DOGE Shifted in Mysterious Transaction, What's Behind It?
data.description:
Dogecoin has seen significant whale activity in the last 24 hours, with a recent 300,000,003 DOGE move catching the attention of the market.

Blockchain data tracker Whale Alert, in recent hours, reported a mystery move of 300,000,003 DOGE worth $55,435,493 between unknown wallets.

Whale Alert reported: "300,000,003 DOGE worth $55,435,493 transferred from unknown wallet to unknown wallet."

Whale Alert
@whale_alert

🚨 🚨 🚨 300,000,003 #DOGE (55,435,493 USD) transferred from unknown wallet to unknown wallethttps://t.co/OjsgrRCNST

Oct 31, 2025

The identity of the wallets remains unknown, as is the reason for the transfer. The transfer coincides with Dogecoin's drop to a low of $0.176 this week.

At press time, DOGE was down 2.08% in the last 24 hours to $0.185, and down 6.06% weekly.

Dogecoin price

Dogecoin fell for four straight days since the start of the week, falling from a high of $0.2095 on Monday to a low of $0.176 on Thursday.

Dogecoin broke below key $0.1940 support during Tuesday’s session, extending its slide as investors weighed macroeconomic concerns.

Yesterday's sharp drop to a low of $0.176 came amid a broader market crash, which saw $1.14 billion in liquidations at one point.

The Federal Reserve's 25-basis-point rate cut was followed by cautious remarks from Chair Jerome Powell, impacting market optimism.

As anticipated, the Federal Reserve delivered a widely expected 25-basis-point rate cut on Wednesday, only for Chair Jerome Powell to dampen optimism with cautious comments suggesting December’s rate cut is not guaranteed.

data.title: Smelly tuna debut undercuts London IPO hype
data.description:
By Karen Kwok

Shares of the $1.5 bln tinned fish maker Princes slipped after it priced at the bottom of the range. It adds to a dismal year for UK listings despite government reforms and cheerleading. To get more companies floating in Britain, a bigger local investor base is the real catch.

Full view will be published shortly.

Follow Karen Kwok on LinkedIn and X.

CONTEXT NEWS

Princes Group, a maker of tinned fish and cooking oil, priced its initial public offering at 475 pence per share on October 31, the bottom of the range it had indicated.

The listing gave Princes, which is majority-owned by Italy-listed food and drinks group NewPrinces, a valuation of 1.16 billion pounds, according to a company statement.

NewPrinces and Newlat Group, the family office of the NewPrinces Chair Angelo Mastrolia, acquired 254.7 million pounds of the 400 million pounds worth of shares offered.

Princes Group shares were trading at 472 pence as of 0830 GMT.

data.title: EU countries split over 2040 climate goal as COP30 looms
data.description:
Key points:
  • EU trying to pass new climate goal before COP30 summit
  • Countries split over speed and cost of CO2 cuts
  • Crunch meeting of ministers on November 4 to seek a deal

By Kate Abnett

European Union countries remain split over their new climate change target and are still debating changes, just days before their ministers are due to approve the goal, according to diplomats and EU documents seen by Reuters on Friday.

The EU is racing to approve a climate target, with the European Commission aiming to reduce planet-warming emissions 90% by 2040, even as some member states worry over the costs to struggling domestic industries.

Failure to reach an agreement would leave Commission President Ursula von der Leyen without a target to present when she meets other world leaders at the U.N.'s COP30 climate summit, undermining the EU's claim to climate leadership.

Asked whether EU governments would agree on a target ahead of the November 6 leaders' gathering at COP30, one EU diplomat told Reuters the bloc was "walking a knife's edge".

Countries including China, Britain and Australia have already announced their new climate targets, but the EU missed a U.N. deadline to do so last month as it struggled to overcome internal disagreements.

CENTRAL STICKING POINTS STILL UNRESOLVED

EU ambassadors gathered in Brussels to lay the groundwork for an agreement on Friday failed to resolve central sticking points, diplomats told Reuters, leaving final negotiations to a meeting of ministers on November 4.

"Ministers will have to work hard on Tuesday," the EU diplomat said.

That EU diplomat and others, all of whom asked not to be named due to the sensitivity of talks, said it was still unclear if an agreement could be struck.

Support from at least 15 of the 27 EU members is needed to pass the goal.

Countries like Italy and Poland have warned the proposed 90% target is too restrictive, while others, including Spain and Sweden, want ambitious emissions cuts.

DISAGREEMENT OVER FOREIGN CARBON CREDITS

A central point of contention is the use by EU countries of foreign carbon credits from developing nations to meet their targets.

France has said credits could potentially cover 5% of the 90% emissions cuts, while Poland also wants a bigger share. Germany has publicly backed 3%, while others including Denmark originally did not want to use foreign carbon credits at all.

The latest draft proposal, seen by Reuters, showed countries have not yet agreed on the percentage of emissions they can offset with foreign carbon credits - which the Commission, in its original proposal, said should be 3% - or the year they can start employing them.

Ahead of Friday's meeting, France also proposed a so-called "emergency brake" that could allow countries to reduce the 90% emissions target by 3% in future, if their forests absorb less CO2 emissions than expected.

The proposal aims to win over sceptical governments by addressing concerns their industries could be forced to cut emissions faster to meet the 2040 goal if forests under-deliver.

A French government spokesperson did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

Disney Channels Pulled from YouTube TV After Contract Talks Fail
data.description:
Disney (DIS, Financials) programming including ABC, ESPN and other major channels went dark on YouTube TV Thursday night after the companies failed to agree on a new distribution deal. The blackout affects millions of subscribers and underscores growing friction between streaming platforms and content providers over rising costs.

YouTube TV said Disney used the threat of a blackout as a negotiating tactic to push for higher prices that would raise costs for viewers. The platform pledged a $20 credit to customers if the outage continues.

Disney had warned of a possible service disruption earlier this week but declined to comment further after the deadline passed. Negotiations reportedly stalled when YouTube requested integration of Disney+, Hulu and ESPN+ content directly within its platform a proposal Disney rejected.

The dispute adds to a string of tense contract renewals across the media industry as companies compete for streaming dominance. Both sides said they remain open to reaching an agreement.

data.title: Canada's Imperial Oil posts profit slump on impairment charge
data.description:
Canadian oil producer Imperial Oil posted a sharp fall in third-quarter profit on Friday, hurt by non-cash impairment and restructuring charges and lower crude prices.

In September, Imperial said it would cut its workforce by about 20% by the end of 2027, part of a major restructuring that would eventually shutter most of its presence in the oil-and-gas city of Calgary.

The planned layoffs come as global crude prices have slumped this year due to increased output from the OPEC+ group of oil producers and trade policy uncertainty.

Benchmark West Texas Intermediate fell nearly 14% in the July–September quarter from last year.

The quarter included a C$306 million after-tax non-cash impairment of Imperial's Calgary campus and a C$249 million after-tax restructuring charge.

The Calgary, Alberta-based company said its net income fell to C$539 million ($385 million), or C$1.07 per share, in the quarter ended September 30, from C$1.24 billion, or C$2.33 per share, a year earlier.

($1 = 1.4024 Canadian dollars)

data.title: AbbVie Beats Third-Quarter Estimates. There's More to the Drugmaker's Earnings. — Barrons.com
data.description:
By Mackenzie Tatananni

AbbVie stock traded slightly lower Friday as the biopharmaceutical giant reported mixed results across its drug portfolios in the third quarter.

Adjusted earnings of $1.86 a share topped the $1.77 consensus among analysts polled by FactSet. Net revenue grew 9.1% to $15.78 billion and narrowly topped the $15.59 billion Wall Street had anticipated.

AbbVie saw growth across its immunology and neuroscience portfolios. Revenue for the segments increased 12% and 20%, respectively. The pharmaceutical giant saw the highest revenue for its blockbuster biologic drugs Skyrizi, Rivoq, and Humira.

However, other lines of business didn't fare as well. Revenue attributed to AbbVie's oncology portfolio declined 0.3% to $1.682 billion, while its aesthetics portfolio took an even larger hit, falling 3.7% to $1.193 billion.

Shares declined 0.3% in the premarket session. Pharma peers Johnson & Johnson and Pfizer also traded down slightly.

AbbVie boosted its adjusted earnings guidance for 2025 to a range of $10.61 to $10.65 a share from $10.38 to $10.58 a share. The new range includes the unfavorable impact tied to research-and-development and milestone expenses, AbbVie said.

The company announced it was increasing its quarterly cash dividend by about 5.5% to $1.73 from $1.64 a share, beginning with the dividend payable on Feb. 17, 2026. AbbVie noted that it has increased its quarterly dividend by more than 330% since its inception in 2013.

Write to Mackenzie Tatananni at mackenzie.tatananni@barrons.com

This content was created by Barron's, which is operated by Dow Jones & Co. Barron's is published independently from Dow Jones Newswires and The Wall Street Journal.

data.title: Getty Images surges on Perplexity partnership
data.description:
** Photo distributor Getty Images shares rise 63.7% to $3.29 premarket

** Co strikes multi-year partnership with AI search startup Perplexity

** Perplexity gains access to GETY's images for its search and discovery tools

** Perplexity will improve its image display and include credit link with source to better educate users on how to use licensed imagery legally

** Up to last close, stock has fallen 7% this year

data.title: REG - Kerry Group PLC - Change in Director Responsibilities
data.description:
RNS Number : 7324F Kerry Group PLC 31 October 2025  

31 October 2025

LEI: 635400TLVVBNXLFHWC59

KERRY GROUP PLC

Change in Director Responsibilities

Change to Audit Committee Chair

In accordance with Euronext Dublin Listing Rule 6.1.5 (3) and UK Listing Rule 6.4.6 (3), Kerry Group plc (the "Company") announces that, as part of the Company's ongoing Board and Committee refreshment programme, Liz Hewitt will succeed Christopher Rogers as Chair of the Company's Audit Committee with effect from today. Mr Rogers will remain a member of the Audit Committee.

Further details on the knowledge, experience and skills of Liz Hewitt are available on the Company's website: https://www.kerry.com/about/leadership and are set out on page 60 of the Company's 2024 Annual Report.

The current members of the Audit Committee are Liz Hewitt (Chair), Fiona Dawson, Michael Kerr, Christopher Rogers and Jinlong Wang, all of whom are non-Executive Directors and considered by the Board to be independent.

  • CONTACT INFORMATION

data.title: Sonim Technologies Reports Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results
data.description:
Sonim Technologies, Inc., a leading provider of rugged mobile solutions for first responders, government, and enterprise, has released its financial results for the third quarter ended September 30, 2025. The company reported significant improvements in revenue and a narrowed net loss, driven by the successful launch of new products and strategic initiatives.

Financial Highlights

For the third quarter of 2025, Sonim Technologies reported a net revenue of $16.2 million, marking a 45% sequential increase from the second quarter of 2025. The company's net loss improved to $4.8 million, down from $7.5 million in the previous quarter. Adjusted EBITDA also showed improvement, coming in at negative $2.0 million compared to negative $3.2 million in Q2 2025.

Business and Operational Highlights

Sonim Technologies launched several new products during the third quarter, including the Sonim MegaConnect™ 5G HPUE hotspot with AT&T, which achieved FirstNet Trusted certification. Other notable product launches included the Sonim XP Pro with T-Mobile in the United States and major carriers in Canada, as well as the Sonim XP Pro Thermal with Deutsche Telekom in Germany.

Strategic Initiatives and Corporate Developments

In July 2025, Sonim entered into a definitive agreement with NEXA Mobility to sell substantially all of its assets for $15.0 million in cash and up to $5.0 million in earn-out payments. This transaction is expected to close in the fourth quarter, subject to customary closing conditions and shareholder approval. Additionally, Sonim stockholders approved a reverse stock split at a ratio of 1-for-18 and an increase in authorized shares to 1 billion, providing flexibility for future capital transactions.

Management's Perspective

Peter Liu, Chief Executive Officer of Sonim Technologies, highlighted the company's strategic focus and the early success of its refreshed product portfolio. He emphasized the importance of the MegaConnect HPUE mobile hotspot launch and the growing demand for Sonim's products. CFO Clay Crolius noted that while one-time expenses related to strategic initiatives impacted short-term results, these efforts position the company for future value creation.

Future Outlook

Looking ahead, Sonim Technologies remains committed to completing the asset sale to NEXA Mobility and exploring strategic opportunities to monetize its Nasdaq listing. The company aims to build on its current momentum and deliver value to stockholders in the fourth quarter of 2025.

Original SEC Filing: SONIM TECHNOLOGIES INC [ SONM ] - 8-K - Oct. 31, 2025
